title: Finca Constancia 2015 Parcela 52 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Distinct yet unusual aromas of vanilla extract and butterscotch announce and confirm that this was barrel fermented. Low vibrancy and bounce on the palate create a sense of flat heaviness. Salty peach and melon flavors are buried in wood spice, while this tastes dry, pithy and resiny on a mild finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Domaine du Tariquet 2016 Classic White (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This is a fruity crisp blend of classic Gascony grapes. It has a clean bright texture with just a touch of honey as well as plenty of lemon and tangy orange. Intensely fruity, it is ready to drink.

title: Kate Radburnd 2015 Berry Burst Rosé (Hawke's Bay)
description: This Merlot-based rosé is a bit on the sweet side. It's juicy and simple, with red plum fruit that finishes with enough acidity for balance.

title: Mendoza Vineyards 2013 Gran Reserva by Richard Bonvin Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Foxy red-berry aromas suggest animal hide and wet fur. This feels raw, wiry and scratchy due to sharp acidity and rough tannins. Foxy herbal plum and currant flavors finish with an abrasive scour, mild heat and salty notes.

title: Adirondack Winery 2016 Million Dollar Beach Gewurztraminer (New York)
description: Musky violet perfume and dusty mineral tones collide on the nose of this slightly sweet Gewürztraminer. Deft body and fresh tangerine and grapefruit flavors are pleasing but the finish is a bit earthy and muddy.

title: Andrero 2016 Grillo (Terre Siciliane)
description: Exotic fruit and herbaceous aromas lift out of the glass. On the bright, simple palate, zesty acidity underscores juicy pineapple and grapefruit notes.

title: Vignobles de Saint-Tropez 2016 Chevalier Torpez Saint-T. Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Pale in color, this is a light-tasting wine. It does have just enough fruit to give some red-fruit flavors. Everything though is light—a crisp reflection of the light of Saint-Tropez. Drink now.

title: Vignobles Ravel 2016 Château Montaud Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: It's good to see a wine in that increasingly rare sight: a Provence skittle-shaped bottle. This is a light and fruity wine from vineyards on the Massif des Maures, close to the sea. It has a bright crisp aftertaste with plenty of acidity to keep it all very crisp. Skittles is the precursor to lawn and indoor bowling.

title: Casarena 2014 Sinco Red (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Baked aromas of raisin are not uncommon for this winery's reds. This has Amarone-like weight backed by flavors of prune, black pepper and medicinal cherry. Heat is a factor on a grapy finish. This Cabernet-Malbec blend doesn't tread lightly.

title: Château des Bertrands 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The wine is smooth, soft and bland. The fruitiness and light acidity give it a crisp edge to what is otherwise a lightly textured wine. The strawberry fruits bring out a gentle aftertaste.

title: Domaine de Laballe 2015 Les Terres Basses Red (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Light, fruity and with attractive red fruits, this is a crisp wine. It has cool tannins and bold acidity. With a juicy aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Vital 2016 Rosé Wine Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: There's just a trace of color on this wine. Light aromas of citrus and herb are followed by dry-fruit flavors. The concentration seems quite dilute.

title: Waterbrook 2015 Melange Founder's White Blend White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Vibrant aromas of pineapple, flowers, peach and lychee lead to an palate that leans sweeter than off dry. Stone-fruit flavors linger on the finish.

title: Tenuta Sarno 1860 2015 Pas Dosé  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: This simple sparkler from Campania opens with subdued acacia and honey aromas. They carry over to the palate, joining yellow apple fruit, brisk acidity and sharp, rather aggressive bubbles. An almond note leaves a bitter finish.

title: Second Growth 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Done in a forward tutti–frutti style, this puts all the flavor right up front. Grape candy is what comes to mind, with a light tannic finish. It's a good gulping wine for decks, campers and picnic outings.

title: La Rajade 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: This opens with subdued, mature yellow apple, acacia and almond aromas that carry over to the abrupt, tangerine-inflected palate. It has a lean, bitter finish.

title: Tortoise Creek 2015 Jam's Blend Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Richly fruity and semisweet, this medium-bodied wine smells like cotton candy and tastes like pear syrup. Smooth in texture and mouth-filling in concentration, it finishes on lingering sweetness.

title: Wellington 2013 Karren Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Plummy with a sour hint of leather, this light-bodied wine, is somewhat flat in structure and finishes lean.

title: Assuli 2015 Fiordiligi Grillo (Terre Siciliane)
description: This fresh, enjoyable white has passion fruit, citrus and saline aromas and flavors. It's simple, with a clean, fresh finish.

title: AuburnJames 2014 Berry Lane Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine opens with a squeeze of acidity and follows through with simple and straightforward citrus flavors.

title: Château Lastours 2016 Les Graviers Rosé (Gaillac)
description: This blend of Duras and Syrah, both local grapes, produced a ripe wine with notes of caramel and rich red fruit. It has concentration as well as acidity, and a spicy, ripe aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château Laulerie 2016  Bergerac Rosé
description: The blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon gives a bright pink colored wine. It has acidity and red-currant fruitiness with a fine lemon-zest tang. With its crisp lightly caramel flavored aftertaste, the wine is fruity and ready to drink.

title: Château Réal Martin 2016 Perle de Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a simple fruity wine. It has a soft texture, an edge of caramel and clean red fruits. With a bright spicy aftertaste, it is attractive and ready now.

title: Chime NV Red (California)
description: A mild sweetness amps up the ripe fruitiness of this medium-bodied and soft-textured wine. It tastes like black cherries, vanilla and oaky spices and finishes with a sugary touch.

title: Compagnie Viticole de Provence 2016 Brin de Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: In another life, the bottle shape could have held gin, but this is definitely a soft pink wine. It has light fruitiness, a gentle smooth texture and a caramel-flavored ripeness. Drink the wine now.

title: Coopers Creek 2013 Pinot Noir (Hawke's Bay)
description: Light-bodied and crisp, this delivers tart cherries and a whack of mocha-tinged oak, which dominates the finish.

title: Corte Mainente 2016  Soave Classico
description: Exotic fruit and citrus aromas lead the nose of this simple white. The lean, zesty palate offers banana, pineapple and grapefruit hints, with firm acidity.

title: Domaine Bousquet 2016 Made With Organically Grown Grapes Chardonnay (Tupungato)
description: Yellow in color and plump on the nose, this Chard smells a bit flat and like quince. In the mouth, this is acidic but lacks depth. Salty flavors of stone fruits are more generic than specific, while this tastes a bit like apricot on an otherwise chunky salty finish.

title: Domaine de Laballe 2016 Les Terres Basses White (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This is a lively fruity light-bodied wine. With some perfumed Gros Manseng in the blend, there is an attractive floral character to the wine. Offering acidity and a bright aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Domaine de Pellehaut 2016 Harmonie de Gascogne White (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: As with many wines from brothers Martin and Mathieu Béraut, this is a blend of many grapes. The combination produces a typical herbal grassy wine, full of tangy citrus fruit and with a touch of apricot from the Petit Manseng in the blend. Drink this now.
